teaser: After some false starts, private rocket maker SpaceX launched a rocket carrying a large commercial satellite into outer space yesterday.
contentencoded: After some false starts, private rocket maker SpaceX launched a rocket carrying a large commercial satellite into outer space yesterday. The company had planned to send the telecom satellite into orbit last week, but technical issues got in the way. This successful launch from Florida's Cape Canaveral could make a big impact on the space industry. Professor John Logsdon, of the Space Policy Institute at George Washington University, tells Marketplace Tech why.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, December 4, 2013
title: SpaceX heads to the stars
